Contents

Convex Sets, functions, basic definitions.

Optimality conditions for constrained possibly non-differentiable convex problems.

Basics of linear algebra and calculus

Convex Set

∀x1,x2∈C,∀λ∈[0,1],λx1+(1−λ)x2∈C\forall x_1, x_2 \in \mathbb{C}, \forall \lambda \in [0,1], \lambda x_1 + (1-\lambda)x_2 \in \mathbb{C}∀x1​,x2​∈C,∀λ∈[0,1],λx1​+(1−λ)x2​∈C

Convex Functions

∀x1,x2∈Rn,∀λ∈[0,1],f(λx1+(1−λ)x2)≤λf(x1)+(1−λ)f(x2)\forall x_1, x_2 \in \mathbb{R}^n, \forall \lambda \in [0,1], f( \lambda x_1 + (1-\lambda)x_2 ) \le \lambda f(x_1) + (1-\lambda)f(x_2)∀x1​,x2​∈Rn,∀λ∈[0,1],f(λx1​+(1−λ)x2​)≤λf(x1​)+(1−λ)f(x2​)

Optimality Conditions for Convex Optimization

Unconstraint

  1. Differentiable
    f convex→f(y)≥f(x^)+<∇f(x^,y−x)>s.t.∇f(x^)=0→f(y)≥f(x^) ∀yf \ convex \rightarrow f(y) \ge f(\hat{x}) + \left < \nabla f(\hat{x}, y-x)\right > \\ \text{s.t.} \quad \nabla f(\hat{x}) = 0 \rightarrow f(y) \ge f(\hat{x}) \ \forall yf convex→f(y)≥f(x^)+⟨∇f(x^,y−x)⟩s.t.∇f(x^)=0→f(y)≥f(x^) ∀y
  2. Non-differentiable
    gx∈∂f(x)⇆f(y)≥f(x)+<gx,y−x>If 0∈∂f(x^)→f(y)≥f(x^)+0 ∀yg_x \in \partial f(x) \leftrightarrows f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < g_x, y-x \right > \\ \text{If} \ 0 \in \partial f(\hat{x}) \rightarrow f(y) \ge f(\hat{x}) + 0 \ \forall ygx​∈∂f(x)⇆f(y)≥f(x)+⟨gx​,y−x⟩If 0∈∂f(x^)→f(y)≥f(x^)+0 ∀y

Constraint

  1. Tangent Cone
  2. Normal Cone
  3. Optimality conditions for constrained optimization
    0∈∇f(x^)+NX(x^)0 \in \nabla f(\hat{x}) + N_{\mathscr{X} }(\hat{x})0∈∇f(x^)+NX​(x^)
  4. Apply optimality conditions to projection
    projection(all convex)
    min⁡12∥x−y∥22s.t.x∈X\min \quad \frac{1}{2} \| x - y \|_2^2 \\ s.t. \quad x \in \mathscr{X}min21​∥x−y∥22​s.t.x∈X
    If x^\hat{x}x^ is an opt. sol.
    0∈∂f(x^)+NX(x^)⇒0∈x^−y+NX(x^)⇒y−x^∈NX(x^)⇒<y−x^,x−x^>≤0∀x∈X0 \in \partial f(\hat{x}) + N_{ \mathscr{X} }(\hat{x}) \\ \Rightarrow 0 \in \hat{x} - y + N_{ \mathscr{X} }(\hat{x}) \Rightarrow y - \hat{x} \in N_{ \mathscr{X} }(\hat{x}) \\ \Rightarrow \left < y- \hat{x}, x - \hat{x} \right > \le 0 \quad \forall x \in { \mathscr{X} }0∈∂f(x^)+NX​(x^)⇒0∈x^−y+NX​(x^)⇒y−x^∈NX​(x^)⇒⟨y−x^,x−x^⟩≤0∀x∈X
  5. Projection onto a convex set is a contraction
    x1x_1x1​ is the projection of y1y_1y1​ onto the convex set X\mathscr{X}X. x2x_2x2​ is the projection of y2y_2y2​ onto the convex set X\mathscr{X}X. Then
    <y1−x1,x2−x1>≤0<y2−x2,x1−x2>≤0\left < y_1 - x_1, x_2 - x_1 \right > \le 0 \\ \left < y_2 - x_2, x_1 - x_2 \right > \le 0⟨y1​−x1​,x2​−x1​⟩≤0⟨y2​−x2​,x1​−x2​⟩≤0
    Add
    <y1−y2−(x1−x2),x1−x2>≥0⇒<y1−y2,x1−x2>−<x1−x2,x1−x2>≥0<y1−y2,x1−x2>≥∥x1−x2∥2<u,v>≤∥u∥∥v∥⇒∥y1−y2∥∥x1−x2∥≥∥x1−x2∥2∥y1−y2∥≥∥x1−x2∥\left < y_1-y_2 - (x_1 - x_2), x_1 -x_2 \right > \ge 0 \Rightarrow \\ \left < y_1-y_2, x_1 -x_2 \right > -\left < x_1 -x_2, x_1 -x_2 \right > \ge 0 \\ \left < y_1-y_2, x_1 -x_2 \right > \ge \|x_1 -x_2 \|^2 \\ \left < u,v \right > \le \|u\| \|v\| \Rightarrow \|y_1-y_2\|\|x_1-x_2\| \ge \|x_1 -x_2 \|^2 \\ \|y_1-y_2\| \ge \|x_1 -x_2 \|⟨y1​−y2​−(x1​−x2​),x1​−x2​⟩≥0⇒⟨y1​−y2​,x1​−x2​⟩−⟨x1​−x2​,x1​−x2​⟩≥0⟨y1​−y2​,x1​−x2​⟩≥∥x1​−x2​∥2⟨u,v⟩≤∥u∥∥v∥⇒∥y1​−y2​∥∥x1​−x2​∥≥∥x1​−x2​∥2∥y1​−y2​∥≥∥x1​−x2​∥

Gradient and Subgradient descent.

Convergence rates for convex functions, for convex and smooth functions, for convex, smooth and strongly convex functions.

Unconstraint

minimize a linear(1st order Taylor) approximation
f(x)≈linear function=f(xk)+<∇f(xk),x−xk>f(x) \approx \text{linear function} = f(x_k) + \left < \nabla f(x_k), x-x_k \right >f(x)≈linear function=f(xk​)+⟨∇f(xk​),x−xk​⟩
Idea: start xkx_kxk​ but not to far at itration kkk.
xk+1=arg min⁡x:f(xk)+<∇f(xk),x−xk>+12η∥x−xk∥2x_{k+1} = \argmin_x:f(x_k) + \left < \nabla f(x_k), x-x_k \right > + \frac{1}{2 \eta} \| x - x_k \|^2xk+1​=xargmin​:f(xk​)+⟨∇f(xk​),x−xk​⟩+2η1​∥x−xk​∥2
Take derive(grad) set to zero:
0+∇f(xk)+1η(x−xk)=0⇒xk+1=xk−η∇f(xk)0 + \nabla f(x_k) + \frac{1}{\eta} (x-x_k) = 0 \Rightarrow x_{k+1} = x_k - \eta \nabla f(x_k)0+∇f(xk​)+η1​(x−xk​)=0⇒xk+1​=xk​−η∇f(xk​)

  • step size: small enough
  • convergence rate: linear or error ≈e−ck\approx e^{ - ck }≈e−ck
  • improvement at every iteration

Subgradient Method:

  • gradient descent improves at every iteration, unlike sub-gradient
  • gradient descent can take a "big" step size: self-tuning property
  • gradient descent takes bigger steps when far away

We formalize these through properties some convex functions have. We will then use properties directly to show different convergence rates, depending on which properties a particular convex function enjoys.

Smooth and Strongly Convex Function

Smoothness

光滑是表征在点附近，梯度也很小

  1. "self-tunning": ∥∇f(x)∥→0 as x→x∗\| \nabla f(x) \| \rightarrow 0 \ \text{as} \ x\rightarrow x^*∥∇f(x)∥→0 as x→x∗
    Need: ∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2≤β⋅∥x−y∥2\| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2 \le \beta \cdot \|x-y\|_2∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2​≤β⋅∥x−y∥2​.
    Def'n: A function f is called β\betaβ-smooth if its gradient is Lispschitz continnous with parameter β\betaβ.
  2. Quadratic upper bound
    Claim: If f(x)f(x)f(x) is β\betaβ-smooth, then: β2∥x∥22−f(x)\frac{\beta}{2}\|x\|_2^2 - f(x)2β​∥x∥22​−f(x) is convex (f(x) maybe not convex). Define g(x)=β2∥x∥22−f(x)g(x) = \frac{\beta}{2}\|x\|_2^2 - f(x)g(x)=2β​∥x∥22​−f(x). We will show g(x)g(x)g(x) is monotone, then monotone applays convex.
    <∇g(x)−∇g(y),x−y>=<β(x−y)−(∇f(x)−∇f(y)),x−y>=β∥x−y∥22−<∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥β∥x−y∥22−∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2⋅∥x−y∥2≥0\left < \nabla g(x) - \nabla g(y), x- y \right> = \left < \beta(x-y) - (\nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y)), x- y \right> \\ = \beta \|x-y\|_2^2 - \left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x-y \right > \\ \ge \beta \|x-y\|_2^2 - \| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2 \cdot \|x-y\|_2 \ge 0⟨∇g(x)−∇g(y),x−y⟩=⟨β(x−y)−(∇f(x)−∇f(y)),x−y⟩=β∥x−y∥22​−⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥β∥x−y∥22​−∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2​⋅∥x−y∥2​≥0
    Then
    g(y)≥g(x)+<∇g(x),y−x>⇒β2∥y∥22−f(y)≥β2∥x∥22−f(x)+<βx−∇f(x),y−x>⇒f(y)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+β2∥y−x∥22g(y) \ge g(x) + \left < \nabla g(x), y-x \right > \Rightarrow \\ \frac{\beta}{2}\|y\|_2^2 - f(y) \ge \frac{\beta}{2}\|x\|_2^2 - f(x) + \left < \beta x - \nabla f(x), y-x \right > \Rightarrow \\ f(y) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x \|_2^2g(y)≥g(x)+⟨∇g(x),y−x⟩⇒2β​∥y∥22​−f(y)≥2β​∥x∥22​−f(x)+⟨βx−∇f(x),y−x⟩⇒f(y)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​
    If fff is twice diff.: f convex ⇔∇2f(x)⪰0\Leftrightarrow \nabla^2 f(x) \succeq 0⇔∇2f(x)⪰0.
    If fff is β\betaβ-smooth ⇔∇2f(x)⪯β⋅I\Leftrightarrow \nabla^2 f(x) \preceq \beta \cdot I⇔∇2f(x)⪯β⋅I.

Strong Convexity

强凸是表征在离点很远地方，可以很快就收敛回来
Define: A function f is strongly convex by parameter α\alphaα if g(x)=f(x)−α2∥x∥22g(x) = f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \| x \|_2^2g(x)=f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​ is convex.
g(y)≥g(x)+<∇g(x),y−x>⇒f(y)−α2∥y∥22≥f(x)−α2∥x∥22+<∇f(x)−αx,y−x>⇒f(y)≥f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+α2∥y−x∥22g(y) \ge g(x) + \left < \nabla g(x), y-x \right > \Rightarrow \\ f(y) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \| y \|_2^2 \ge f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \| x \|_2^2 + \left < \nabla f(x) - \alpha x, y-x \right > \Rightarrow \\ f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x) , y-x \right > + \frac{\alpha}{2} \|y -x \|_2^2g(y)≥g(x)+⟨∇g(x),y−x⟩⇒f(y)−2α​∥y∥22​≥f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​+⟨∇f(x)−αx,y−x⟩⇒f(y)≥f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2α​∥y−x∥22​
Strong Convexity add the term α2∥y−x∥22\frac{\alpha}{2} \|y -x \|_2^22α​∥y−x∥22​ in the definition of the convex.

If f(x)f(x)f(x) is twice differentiable and α\alphaα-strongly convex ⇔∇2f(x)⪰α⋅I⇔(∇2f(x)−αI)⪰0\Leftrightarrow \nabla^2 f(x) \succeq \alpha \cdot I \Leftrightarrow (\nabla^2 f(x) - \alpha I ) \succeq 0⇔∇2f(x)⪰α⋅I⇔(∇2f(x)−αI)⪰0.

Properties of Smooth Functions.

函数f(x)f(x)f(x) 性质
convex f(y)≥f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right >f(y)≥f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩
β\betaβ-smooth ∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2≤β⋅∥x−y∥2\| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2 \le \beta \cdot \|x-y\|_2∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2​≤β⋅∥x−y∥2​ f(y)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+β2∥y−x∥22f(y) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x \|_2^2f(y)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​
α\alphaα-convex f(y)≥f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+α2∥y−x∥22f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x) , y-x \right > + \frac{\alpha}{2} \|y -x \|_2^2f(y)≥f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2α​∥y−x∥22​
  1. Smoothness guarantees improvement
    GD: x+=x−η∇f(x)→x+−x=−η∇f(x)x^{+} = x - \eta \nabla f(x) \rightarrow x^+ - x = - \eta \nabla f(x)x+=x−η∇f(x)→x+−x=−η∇f(x)
    Then
    f(x+)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),x+−x>+β2∥x+−x∥=f(x)−η<∇f(x),∇f(x)>+β2η2∥∇f(x)∥2=f(x)−η(1−ηβ2)∥∇f(x)∥2⇒f(x+)−f(x)≤−η(1−ηβ2)∥∇f(x)∥2f(x^+) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), x^+ -x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \| x^+ - x\| \\ = f(x) - \eta \left < \nabla f(x), \nabla f(x) \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \eta^2 \| \nabla f(x) \|^2 \\ = f(x) - \eta (1 - \eta \frac{\beta}{2}) \| \nabla f(x) \|^2 \\ \Rightarrow f(x^+)- f(x) \le - \eta (1 - \eta \frac{\beta}{2}) \| \nabla f(x) \|^2f(x+)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),x+−x⟩+2β​∥x+−x∥=f(x)−η⟨∇f(x),∇f(x)⟩+2β​η2∥∇f(x)∥2=f(x)−η(1−η2β​)∥∇f(x)∥2⇒f(x+)−f(x)≤−η(1−η2β​)∥∇f(x)∥2
    If we choose η\etaη small enough(η<2β\eta < \frac{2}{\beta}η<β2​) that η(1−ηβ2)≥0\eta (1 - \eta \frac{\beta}{2}) \ge 0η(1−η2β​)≥0, then we guarantee improvement. Typically we choose η=1β\eta = \frac{1}{\beta}η=β1​:
    x+=x−1β∇f(x) & η(1−η⋅β2)=12β⇒f(x+)≤f(x)−12β∥∇f(x)∥22x^+ = x - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla f(x) \ \And \ \eta(1-\eta \cdot \frac{\beta}{2}) = \frac{1}{2 \beta} \\ \Rightarrow f(x^+) \le f(x) - \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla f(x) \|_2^2x+=x−β1​∇f(x) & η(1−η⋅2β​)=2β1​⇒f(x+)≤f(x)−2β1​∥∇f(x)∥22​
  2. Bound on suboptimality of any point
    If f is β\betaβ-smooth:
    12β∥∇f(x)∥22≤(a)f(x)−f(x∗)≤(b)β2∥x−x∗∥22\frac{1}{2 \beta}\| \nabla f(x) \|_2^2 \overset{(a)}{\le} f(x) - f(x^*) \overset{(b)}{\le} \frac{\beta}{2} \| x-x^* \|_2^22β1​∥∇f(x)∥22​≤(a)​f(x)−f(x∗)≤(b)​2β​∥x−x∗∥22​
    Again, use quadic upper bound: f(y)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+β2∥y−x∥22f(y) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x \|_2^2f(y)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​
    For (b)(b)(b),
    f(x)≤f(x∗)+<∇f(x∗),x−x∗>+β2∥x−x∗∥22⇒∇f(x∗)=0f(x)−f(x∗)≤β2∥x−x∗∥22f(x) \le f(x^*) + \left < \nabla f(x^*), x-x^* \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|x-x^* \|_2^2 \\ \overset{\nabla f(x^*)=0}{\Rightarrow} f(x) - f(x^*) \le \frac{\beta}{2} \|x-x^* \|_2^2f(x)≤f(x∗)+⟨∇f(x∗),x−x∗⟩+2β​∥x−x∗∥22​⇒∇f(x∗)=0f(x)−f(x∗)≤2β​∥x−x∗∥22​
    For (a)(a)(a),
    f(x∗)≤f(y)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+β2∥y−x∥22f(x^*) \le f(y) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x \|_2^2f(x∗)≤f(y)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​
    Minimize the quad. upper bound over yyy, find ∇f(x)+β(y−x)=0⇒y=x−1β∇f(x)\nabla f(x) + \beta (y-x) = 0 \Rightarrow y = x - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla f(x)∇f(x)+β(y−x)=0⇒y=x−β1​∇f(x). Now plug in this value of y we get (a)(a)(a).
  3. Co-coercivity
    If f is β\betaβ-smooth: <∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥1β∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x-y \right > \ge \frac{1}{\beta} \| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2^2⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥β1​∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22​.
    To show this:
    fx(z)=f(z)−<∇f(x),z>z∗=x is minimizer of fx(z)fy(z)=f(z)−<∇f(y),z>z∗=y is minimizer of fy(z)f(y)−(f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>)=f(y)−<∇f(x),y>−(f(x)−<∇f(x),x>)=fx(y)−fx(x)⇒(a)≥12β∥∇fx(y)∥22=≥12β∥∇f(y)−∇f(x)∥22f_x(z) = f(z) - \left < \nabla f(x), z \right > \quad z^* =x \ \text{is minimizer of} \ f_x(z) \\ f_y(z) = f(z) - \left < \nabla f(y), z \right > \quad z^* =y \ \text{is minimizer of} \ f_y(z) \\ f(y)-( f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right >) = f(y) - \left < \nabla f(x), y \right > - ( f(x) - \left < \nabla f(x), x \right > ) \\ = f_x(y) - f_x(x) \overset{(a)}{\Rightarrow} \\ \ge \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla f_x (y) \|_2^2 = \ge \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla f (y) - \nabla f (x) \|_2^2fx​(z)=f(z)−⟨∇f(x),z⟩z∗=x is minimizer of fx​(z)fy​(z)=f(z)−⟨∇f(y),z⟩z∗=y is minimizer of fy​(z)f(y)−(f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩)=f(y)−⟨∇f(x),y⟩−(f(x)−⟨∇f(x),x⟩)=fx​(y)−fx​(x)⇒(a)≥2β1​∥∇fx​(y)∥22​=≥2β1​∥∇f(y)−∇f(x)∥22​
    Similarliy, by flipping roles of x,yx,yx,y:
    f(x)−(f(y)+<∇f(y),x−y>)≥12β∥∇f(y)−∇f(x)∥22f(x)-( f(y) + \left < \nabla f(y), x-y \right >) \ge \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla f (y) - \nabla f (x) \|_2^2f(x)−(f(y)+⟨∇f(y),x−y⟩)≥2β1​∥∇f(y)−∇f(x)∥22​
    Adding gives co-coricivity.

Properties of Strongly Convex Functions.

函数f(x)f(x)f(x) 性质
convex f(y)≥f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right >f(y)≥f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩
β\betaβ-smooth: ∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2≤β⋅∥x−y∥2\| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2 \le \beta \cdot \|x-y\|_2∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥2​≤β⋅∥x−y∥2​ f(y)≤f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+β2∥y−x∥22f(y) \le f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x), y-x \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x \|_2^2f(y)≤f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​
α\alphaα-convex: f(x)−α2∥x∥2f(x)-\frac{\alpha}{2}\|x\|^2f(x)−2α​∥x∥2 convex f(y)≥f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+α2∥y−x∥22f(y) \ge f(x) + \left < \nabla f(x) , y-x \right > + \frac{\alpha}{2} \|y -x \|_2^2f(y)≥f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2α​∥y−x∥22​

  1. Bound on suboptimality of any point
    If f is α\alphaα-strongly convex:
    α2∥x−x∗∥22≤(a)f(x)−f(x∗)≤(b)12α∥∇f(x)∥22\frac{\alpha}{2 } \| x-x^* \|_2^2 \overset{(a)}{\le} f(x) - f(x^*) \overset{(b)}{\le} \frac{1}{2 \alpha} \| \nabla f(x) \|_2^22α​∥x−x∗∥22​≤(a)​f(x)−f(x∗)≤(b)​2α1​∥∇f(x)∥22​
    For both (a)(a)(a) and (b)(b)(b) we use quadratic upper bound
    f(x)≥f(x∗)+<∇f(x∗),x−x∗>+α2∥x−x∗∥22⇒f(x)−f(x∗)≥α2∥x−x∗∥22f(x) \ge f(x^*) + \left < \nabla f(x^*),x-x^* \right > + \frac{\alpha}{2} \|x-x^* \|_2^2 \\ \Rightarrow f(x) - f(x^*) \ge \frac{\alpha}{2} \|x-x^* \|_2^2f(x)≥f(x∗)+⟨∇f(x∗),x−x∗⟩+2α​∥x−x∗∥22​⇒f(x)−f(x∗)≥2α​∥x−x∗∥22​
    For (b)(b)(b),
    f(x∗)≥min⁡y:f(x)+<∇f(x),y−x>+α2∥y−x∥22f(x^*) \ge \min_y: f(x)+ \left < \nabla f(x) , y-x \right > + \frac{\alpha}{2} \|y -x \|_2^2f(x∗)≥ymin​:f(x)+⟨∇f(x),y−x⟩+2α​∥y−x∥22​
    Take grad., set to zero: ∇f(x)+α2(y−x)=0\nabla f(x) + \frac{\alpha}{2}(y-x) = 0∇f(x)+2α​(y−x)=0, plugging in
    f(x)−f(x∗)≤12α∥∇f(x)∥22f(x) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{2 \alpha} \| \nabla f(x) \|_2^2f(x)−f(x∗)≤2α1​∥∇f(x)∥22​

  2. Coericivity
    If f is α\alphaα-strongly convex:
    <∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥α∥x−y∥22\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x-y \right > \ge \alpha \| x - y \|_2^2⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥α∥x−y∥22​
    Recall f is α\alphaα-s.c. if g(x)=f(x)−α2∥x∥22g(x) = f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2}\|x\|_2^2g(x)=f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​ is convex. g(x)g(x)g(x) convex ⇔\Leftrightarrow⇔ ∇g(x)\nabla g(x)∇g(x) monotone.
    <∇g(x)−∇g(y),x−y>≥0<∇f(x)−∇f(y)−α(x−y),x−y>≥0⇒<∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥α∥x−y∥22\left < \nabla g(x) - \nabla g(y), x-y \right > \ge 0 \\ \left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) - \alpha(x-y), x-y \right > \ge 0 \\ \Rightarrow \left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) , x-y \right > \ge \alpha \| x - y \|_2^2⟨∇g(x)−∇g(y),x−y⟩≥0⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y)−α(x−y),x−y⟩≥0⇒⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥α∥x−y∥22​

Convergence Rates

Goal: obtain bounds on sub-optimality of xtx_txt​: f(xk)−f(x∗)f(x_k) - f(x^*)f(xk​)−f(x∗). What does this gap look like as the function of kkk the number of iterations.

Subgradient method

xt+1=xt−ηgt, gt∈∂f(xt)x_{t+1} = x_t - \eta g_t, \ g_t \in \partial f(x_t)xt+1​=xt​−ηgt​, gt​∈∂f(xt​)
Let f be convex. Assume:∀x, ∀gx∈∂f(x),∥gx∥2≤G\forall x, \ \forall g_x \in \partial f(x), \| g_x \|_2 \le G∀x, ∀gx​∈∂f(x),∥gx​∥2​≤G.
∥xt+1−x∗∥22=∥xt−ηgt−x∗∥22=∥xt−x∗∥22−2η<gt,xt−x∗>+η2∥gt∥22→convexity≤∥xt−x∗∥22−2η(f(xt)−f(x∗))+η2G2⇒f(xt)−f(x∗)≤12η(∥xt+1−x∗∥22−∥xt−x∗∥22telescope once we sum over t)+η2G2\textcolor{blue}{ \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 }= \| x_t - \eta g_t - x^* \|_2^2 = \\ \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - 2 \eta \textcolor{red}{\left < g_t, x_t - x^* \right >} + \eta^2 \| g_t \|_2^2 \\ \overset{convexity}{\rightarrow} \le \textcolor{blue}{ \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 } - 2 \eta \textcolor{red}{\left ( f(x_t) - f(x^*) \right )} + \eta^2 \textcolor{green}{G^2} \\ \Rightarrow \textcolor{red}{ f(x_t) - f(x^*) } \le \frac{1}{2 \eta} \big ( \underset{ \text{telescope once we sum over t} }{ \textcolor{blue}{ \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 } - \textcolor{blue}{ \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 } } \big ) + \frac{\eta}{2} \textcolor{green}{G^2}∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−ηgt​−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−x∗∥22​−2η⟨gt​,xt​−x∗⟩+η2∥gt​∥22​→convexity≤∥xt​−x∗∥22​−2η(f(xt​)−f(x∗))+η2G2⇒f(xt​)−f(x∗)≤2η1​(telescope once we sum over t∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​−∥xt​−x∗∥22​​)+2η​G2
Then
1T∑t=1T(f(xt)−f(x∗))≤12η1T(∥x1−x∗∥22−∥xT−x∗∥22⏟dropping this term)+η2G2\frac{1}{T} \sum_{t=1}^T ( f(x_t) - f(x^*) ) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta} \frac{1}{T} \big ( \textcolor{blue}{ \| x_{1} - x^* \|_2^2 } - \underbrace{ \textcolor{blue}{ \| x_T - x^* \|_2^2 } }_{\text{dropping this term}} \big ) + \frac{\eta}{2} \textcolor{green}{G^2}T1​t=1∑T​(f(xt​)−f(x∗))≤2η1​T1​(∥x1​−x∗∥22​−dropping this term∥xT​−x∗∥22​​​)+2η​G2
Claim
f(1T∑xt)−f(x∗)≤1T∑t=1T(f(xt)−f(x∗))f(\frac{1}{T} \sum x_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{T} \sum_{t=1}^T ( f(x_t) - f(x^*) )f(T1​∑xt​)−f(x∗)≤T1​t=1∑T​(f(xt​)−f(x∗))
Then
f(1T∑xt)−f(x∗)≤12ηTR2+η2G2where R2=∥x1−x∗∥22f(\frac{1}{T} \sum x_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta T} R^2 + \frac{\eta}{2} {G^2} \\ \text{where} \ R^2 = \| x_{1} - x^* \|_2^2f(T1​∑xt​)−f(x∗)≤2ηT1​R2+2η​G2where R2=∥x1​−x∗∥22​
The best η∼1T\eta \sim \frac{1}{\sqrt T}η∼T​1​.
Summary

  1. If we plan to run for T iterations, best step size η∼1T\eta \sim \frac{1}{\sqrt T}η∼T​1​.
  2. Error after T iterations ∼1T\sim \frac{1}{\sqrt T}∼T​1​. Or to have error ϵ\epsilonϵ need ∼1ϵ2\sim \textcolor{red}{\frac{1}{\epsilon^2}}∼ϵ21​ iterations.
  3. This is good news. Sub-gradient mehod produces ϵ\epsilonϵ-opt. solution.
  4. dimension-free\textcolor{blue}{\text{dimension-free}}dimension-free.

Gradient descent for smooth functions

f(x)f(x)f(x) is a β\betaβ-smooth, convex function
xt+1=xt−η∇f(xt)=xt−1β∇f(xt)x_{t+1} = x_t - \eta \nabla f(x_t) = x_t - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla f(x_t)xt+1​=xt​−η∇f(xt​)=xt​−β1​∇f(xt​)
Recall:
f(xt+1)≤f(xt)−η2∥∇f(xt)∥22 ( holds for any η≤1β)≤f(x∗)+<∇f(xt),xt−x∗>−η2∥∇f(xt)∥22=f(x∗)+12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥xt−x∗−η∇f(xt)∥22⏟∥xt+1−x∗∥22)=f(x∗)+12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥xt+1−x∗∥22⏟telescope once we sum)f(x_{t+1} ) \le f(x_t) - \frac{\eta}{2} \| \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2 \ ( \text{ holds for any } \eta \le\frac{1}{\beta}) \\ \le \textcolor{blue}{ f(x^*) + \left < \nabla f(x_t), x_t - x^* \right > } - \frac{\eta}{2} \| \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2 \\ = f(x^*) + \frac{1}{2 \eta} \big ( \|x_t-x^*\|_2^2 - \underbrace{ \|x_t-x^*- \eta \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2}_{\|x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2} \big ) \\ = f(x^*) + \frac{1}{2 \eta} \big ( \underbrace{\|x_t-x^*\|_2^2 - \|x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2}_{\text{telescope once we sum}} \big )f(xt+1​)≤f(xt​)−2η​∥∇f(xt​)∥22​ ( holds for any η≤β1​)≤f(x∗)+⟨∇f(xt​),xt​−x∗⟩−2η​∥∇f(xt​)∥22​=f(x∗)+2η1​(∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​∥xt​−x∗−η∇f(xt​)∥22​​​)=f(x∗)+2η1​(telescope once we sum∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​​​)
Then
f(xt)−f(x∗)≤1T∑(f(xt)−f(x∗))≤1T⋅12η⋅∥x0−x∗∥22=1T(β2⋅R2)f(x_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{T}\sum ( f(x_t) - f(x^*) ) \le \frac{1}{T} \cdot \frac{1}{2 \eta} \cdot \|x_0 - x^* \|_2^2 \\ = \frac{1}{T} \big ( \frac{\beta}{2} \cdot R^2)f(xt​)−f(x∗)≤T1​∑(f(xt​)−f(x∗))≤T1​⋅2η1​⋅∥x0​−x∗∥22​=T1​(2β​⋅R2)

Suboptimality scales like ∼1T\sim \frac{1}{T}∼T1​. For error ϵ∼1ϵ\epsilon \sim \textcolor{red}{\frac{1}{\epsilon}}ϵ∼ϵ1​.

Note: use of the "self-tuning" properity of smooth function.

Gradient descent for smooth and strongly convex functions

Recall co-coericivity of smooth function: <∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥1β∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x-y \right > \ge \frac{1}{\beta} \| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2^2⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥β1​∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22​.
Assume f is α\alphaα-strongly convex and β\betaβ-smooth. f(x)−α2∥x∥22f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \|x\|_2^2f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​ is convex. Also this is (β−α)(\beta - \alpha)(β−α) smooth (f is γ\gammaγ-smooth if γ2∥x∥22−f(x)\frac{\gamma}{2} \|x\|_2^2-f(x)2γ​∥x∥22​−f(x) is convex).
Co-coericivity of (f(x)−α2∥x∥22)(f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \|x\|_2^2)(f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​) implies:
<∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥α∥x−y∥22+1β−α∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22+α2β−α∥x−y∥22−2αβ−α<∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x- y\right > \ge \alpha \|x-y\|_2^2 + \\ \frac{1}{\beta - \alpha} \| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2^2 + \frac{\alpha^2}{\beta-\alpha} \|x-y\|_2^2 - \frac{2 \alpha}{\beta - \alpha}\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x- y\right >⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥α∥x−y∥22​+β−α1​∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22​+β−αα2​∥x−y∥22​−β−α2α​⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩
Simplifying, we find
<∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y>≥αββ+α∥x−y∥22+1α+β∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22\left < \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y), x- y\right > \ge \frac{\alpha \beta}{\beta+\alpha} \|x-y\|_2^2 + \frac{1}{\alpha+\beta} \| \nabla f(x) - \nabla f(y) \|_2^2⟨∇f(x)−∇f(y),x−y⟩≥β+ααβ​∥x−y∥22​+α+β1​∥∇f(x)−∇f(y)∥22​
Take the stepsize η=2α+β,xt+1=xt−η∇f(xt)\eta = \frac{2}{\alpha+\beta}, x_{t+1} = x_t - \eta \nabla f(x_t)η=α+β2​,xt+1​=xt​−η∇f(xt​)
∥xt+1−x∗∥22=∥xt−η∇f(xt)−x∗∥22=∥xt−x∗∥22−2η<∇f(xt),xt−x∗>⏟<∇f(xt)−∇f(x∗),xt−x∗>+η2∥∇f(xt)∥22{ \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 }=\| x_t - \eta \nabla f(x_t) - x^* \|_2^2 \\ = \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - 2 \eta \underbrace{ \textcolor{red}{\left < \nabla f(x_t), x_t - x^* \right >}}_{\left < \nabla f(x_t) - \nabla f(x^*), x_t - x^* \right >} + \eta^2 \| \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−η∇f(xt​)−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−x∗∥22​−2η⟨∇f(xt​)−∇f(x∗),xt​−x∗⟩⟨∇f(xt​),xt​−x∗⟩​​+η2∥∇f(xt​)∥22​
Use the Co-coericivity of f(x)−α2∥x∥22f(x) - \frac{\alpha}{2} \|x\|_2^2f(x)−2α​∥x∥22​ we get
<∇f(xt)−∇f(x∗),xt−x∗>≥αα+β∥xt−x∗∥22+1α+β∥∇f(xt)−∇f(x∗)∥22\left < \nabla f(x_t) - \nabla f(x^*), x_t - x^* \right > \ge \frac{\alpha}{\alpha + \beta} \|x_t - x^* \|_2^2 + \frac{1}{\alpha + \beta} \| \nabla f(x_t) - \nabla f(x^*) \|_2^2⟨∇f(xt​)−∇f(x∗),xt​−x∗⟩≥α+βα​∥xt​−x∗∥22​+α+β1​∥∇f(xt​)−∇f(x∗)∥22​
Then plugging in
∥xt+1−x∗∥22≤(1−2ηαα+β)∥xt−x∗∥22+(η2−2η1α+β)∥∇f(xt)∥22≤plug in η(1−2ηαβα+β)∥xt−x∗∥22≤(1−2ηαβα+β)t⋅∥x1−x∗∥22⇒∥xt+1−x∗∥2≤(β/α−1β/α+1)t∥x1−x∗∥2{ \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 } \le \big( 1 - 2 \eta \frac{\alpha}{\alpha+\beta} \big) \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 + \big ( \eta^2 - 2 \eta \frac{1}{\alpha+\beta} \big) \| \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2 \\ \overset{\text{plug in }\eta} {\le} \big ( 1 - 2 \eta \frac{\alpha \beta}{\alpha+\beta} \big ) \| x_{t} - x^* \|_2^2 \\ \le \big ( 1 - 2 \eta \frac{\alpha \beta}{\alpha+\beta} \big )^t \cdot \| x_{1} - x^* \|_2^2 \\ \Rightarrow \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2 \le \big (\frac{\beta / \alpha - 1 }{ \beta / \alpha + 1 } \big )^t \| x_{1} - x^* \|_2∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​≤(1−2ηα+βα​)∥xt​−x∗∥22​+(η2−2ηα+β1​)∥∇f(xt​)∥22​≤plug in η​(1−2ηα+βαβ​)∥xt​−x∗∥22​≤(1−2ηα+βαβ​)t⋅∥x1​−x∗∥22​⇒∥xt+1​−x∗∥2​≤(β/α+1β/α−1​)t∥x1​−x∗∥2​
κ=β/α\kappa = \beta / \alphaκ=β/α condition number.

Summary
f is α\alphaα-strongly convex, β\betaβ-smooth

  1. suboptimality ∼CT\sim C^T∼CT, C=(κ−1κ+1)<1C = (\frac{\kappa-1}{\kappa+1}) < 1C=(κ+1κ−1​)<1
  2. For error ϵ∼log(1/ϵ)\epsilon \sim \text{log}(1/\epsilon)ϵ∼log(1/ϵ) iterations.

Oracle Lower Bounds and Accelerated Methods

functions Error Iterations
Sugradient method for Lip. convex func. O(1T)O(\frac{1}{\sqrt{T}})O(T​1​) O(1/ϵ2)O(1/\epsilon^2)O(1/ϵ2)
GD for smooth convex func. O(1T)O(\frac{1}{{T}})O(T1​) O(1/ϵ)O(1/\epsilon)O(1/ϵ)
GD for smooth and s.c func. O((κ−1κ+1)T)O(({\frac{\kappa-1}{\kappa+1}})^T)O((κ+1κ−1​)T) O(κlog(1/ϵ))O(\kappa \text{log}(1/\epsilon))O(κlog(1/ϵ))

Oracle model of computation - what do we know about our function?

graph LR A[x] --> B[Oracle] B[Oracle] --> C["grad f(X)"] B[Oracle] --> D["subgrad f(X)"]

Suppose the only access we have to our function fff is though the Oracle.
Q: How many calls to the oracle do we need in the worst case over a class of functions in order to guarantee error ϵ\epsilonϵ?

  • For the class of Lips. convex function, there is no algorithm which can guarantee error better than O(1/T)O(1/\sqrt{T})O(1/T​) for all functions in this class.
  • This tells us that the subgradient method is unimprovable.
  • For smooth functions, ... the lower bound is o(1/T2)o(1/T^2)o(1/T2).
  • For β\betaβ-smooth and α\alphaα-s.c. functions, ... the lower bound is O((κ−1κ+1)T)O((\frac{\sqrt{\kappa} - 1}{\sqrt{\kappa} + 1} )^T )O((κ​+1κ​−1​)T).
  • Can we find an algorithm to match.

Is the assumption reasonable? What is the takeaway?
If we develop any algorithm that only uses evaluations of f(x)f(x)f(x) and ∇f(x)\nabla f(x)∇f(x), then we are bound by the oracle-lower-bounds.

Accelerated Gradient Descent: Momentum

Recall:

Column A GD LB
β\betaβ-smooth 1/T1/T1/T 1/T21/T^21/T2
β\betaβ-sm and α\alphaα-s.c. (κ−1κ+1)T(\frac{\kappa - 1}{\kappa + 1})^T(κ+1κ−1​)T (κ−1κ+1)T(\frac{\sqrt{\kappa}-1}{\sqrt{\kappa}+1})^T(κ​+1κ​−1​)T

Idea of momentum: (xt−xt−1)(x_t - x_{t-1})(xt​−xt−1​) as velocity something

Acceleration:Smooth and strongly convex functions

GD: xt+1=xt−η∇f(xt),η=1/βx_{t+1} = x_t - \eta \nabla f(x_t), \eta = 1/\betaxt+1​=xt​−η∇f(xt​),η=1/β
AGD:
Initialize: xt=yt=xinityt+1=xt−1β∇f(xt)xt+1=(1+κ−1κ+1)yt+1−(κ−1κ+1)yt\text{Initialize:} \ x_t = y_t = x_{init} \\ y_{t+1} = x_t - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla f(x_t) \\ x_{t+1} = \big ( 1+ \frac{\sqrt{\kappa}-1}{\sqrt{\kappa}+1} \big ) y_{t+1} - \big ( \frac{\sqrt{\kappa}-1}{\sqrt{\kappa}+1} \big ) y_{t}Initialize: xt​=yt​=xinit​yt+1​=xt​−β1​∇f(xt​)xt+1​=(1+κ​+1κ​−1​)yt+1​−(κ​+1κ​−1​)yt​
Thm:
f(yt)−f(x∗)≤α+β2∥x1−x∗∥2⋅exp⁡{−t+1κ}f(y_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{\alpha+\beta}{2} \|x_1 - x^* \|^2 \cdot \exp \bigg \{ - \frac{t+1}{\sqrt{\kappa}} \bigg \}f(yt​)−f(x∗)≤2α+β​∥x1​−x∗∥2⋅exp{−κ​t+1​}
We have improved from κ→κ\kappa \rightarrow \sqrt{ \kappa }κ→κ​.
Recall: depence on codition number:

Acceleration: smooth function

Gradient: x=x−η∇f(x)x^ = x - \eta \nabla f(x)x=x−η∇f(x)
Momentum: dt=γt(xt−xt−1)d_t = \gamma_t (x_t - x_{t-1} )dt​=γt​(xt​−xt−1​)
GD Alg: xt+1=(xt)+x_{t+1} = (x_t)^+xt+1​=(xt​)+
Nesterov Acceleration:
xt+1=(xt+dt)+=xt+dt−η∇f(xt+dt⏞add before gradient)x_{t+1} = (x_t + d_t)^+ = x_t + d_t - \eta \nabla f(\overbrace{x_t + d_t}^{\text{add before gradient}})xt+1​=(xt​+dt​)+=xt​+dt​−η∇f(xt​+dt​​add before gradient​)
f is convex and β\betaβ-smooth, will show we match LB: 1/T21/T^21/T2 compared.

Proof(S.Bubeck):
xt+1=(xt+dt)+=xt+dt−η∇f(xt+dt)convexity⇒f(x)−f(y)≤<∇f(x),x−y>smooth⇒f(y)−f(x)≤<∇f(x),x−y>+β2∥y−x∥22η=1/β⇒f(x+)−f(x)≤−12β∥∇f(x)∥22x_{t+1} = (x_t + d_t)^+ = x_t + d_t - \eta \nabla f({x_t + d_t}) \\ \text{convexity} \Rightarrow f(x)-f(y) \le \left < \nabla f(x), x-y \right > \\ \text{smooth} \Rightarrow f(y) - f(x) \le \left < \nabla f(x), x-y \right > + \frac{\beta}{2} \|y-x\|_2^2 \\ \eta = 1/\beta \Rightarrow f(x^+) - f(x) \le - \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla f(x) \|_2^2xt+1​=(xt​+dt​)+=xt​+dt​−η∇f(xt​+dt​)convexity⇒f(x)−f(y)≤⟨∇f(x),x−y⟩smooth⇒f(y)−f(x)≤⟨∇f(x),x−y⟩+2β​∥y−x∥22​η=1/β⇒f(x+)−f(x)≤−2β1​∥∇f(x)∥22​
notation: δt=f(xt0)−f(x∗)≥0, gt=−1β∇f(xt+dt)\delta_t = f(x_t0) - f(x^*) \ge 0, \ g_t = - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla f( x_t + d_t )δt​=f(xt​0)−f(x∗)≥0, gt​=−β1​∇f(xt​+dt​). Then xt+1=xt+dt+gtx_{t+1} = x_t + d_t + g_txt+1​=xt​+dt​+gt​
Two bounds:

  • (a)δt+1−δt≤−β2(∥gt∥2+2gtTdt)\delta_{t+1} - \delta_t \le - \frac{\beta}{2} \big ( \|g_t\|^2 + 2 g_t^T d_t \big)δt+1​−δt​≤−2β​(∥gt​∥2+2gtT​dt​)
  • (b) δt+1≤−β2(∥gt∥2+2gtT(xt+dt−x∗))\delta_{t+1} \le - \frac{\beta}{2} \big ( \|g_t\|^2 + 2 g_t^T ( x_t + d_t - x^*) \big )δt+1​≤−2β​(∥gt​∥2+2gtT​(xt​+dt​−x∗))

For (a)(a)(a), plugging the definition of gtg_tgt​
−β2(1β2∥∇f(xt+dt)∥22−2β∇f(xt+dt)Tdt)=−12β∥∇f(xt+dt)∥22+∇f(xt+dt)Tdt≥convexity and smoothf(xt+dt−η∇f(xt+dt))−f(xt+dt)+f(xt+dt)−f(xt)≥δt+1−δt-\frac{\beta}{2} \bigg ( \frac{1}{\beta^2} \|\nabla f(x_t + d_t) \|_2^2 - \frac{2}{\beta} \nabla f(x_t + d_t)^T d_t \bigg ) \\ = - \frac{1}{2 \beta} \|\nabla f(x_t + d_t) \|_2^2 + \nabla f(x_t + d_t)^T d_t \\ \underset{\text{convexity and smooth}}{\ge} f(x_t + d_t - \eta \nabla f(x_t + d_t )) - f(x_t + d_t) + f(x_t + d_t) - f(x_t) \\ \ge \delta_{t+1} - \delta_t−2β​(β21​∥∇f(xt​+dt​)∥22​−β2​∇f(xt​+dt​)Tdt​)=−2β1​∥∇f(xt​+dt​)∥22​+∇f(xt​+dt​)Tdt​convexity and smooth≥​f(xt​+dt​−η∇f(xt​+dt​))−f(xt​+dt​)+f(xt​+dt​)−f(xt​)≥δt+1​−δt​

Take a convex combination of (a)(a)(a) and (b)(b)(b)
(λt−1)(a)+1⋅(b)≤−β2[1λt(∥xt+λtdt−x∗+λtgt∥22−∥xt+λtdt−x∗∥22)](\lambda_t - 1)(a) + 1 \cdot (b) \le -\frac{\beta}{2} \bigg [ \frac{1}{\lambda_t} \bigg ( \|x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* + \lambda_t g_t \|_2^2 - \|x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* \|_2^2 \bigg ) \bigg ](λt​−1)(a)+1⋅(b)≤−2β​[λt​1​(∥xt​+λt​dt​−x∗+λt​gt​∥22​−∥xt​+λt​dt​−x∗∥22​)]
We could like for the RHS to be telescoping, want:
xt+λtdt−x∗+λtgt=xt+1+λt+1dt+1−x∗x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* + \lambda_t g_t = x_{t+1} + \lambda_{t+1} d_{t+1} - x^*xt​+λt​dt​−x∗+λt​gt​=xt+1​+λt+1​dt+1​−x∗
Recall: dt+1=γt+1(dt+gt)d_{t+1} = \textcolor{red}{\gamma_{t+1}} ( d_t + g_t )dt+1​=γt+1​(dt​+gt​), then plugging what we want
xt+λtdt−x∗+λtgt=xt+1+λt+1γt+1(dt+gt)−x∗=xt+dt+gt+λt+1γt+1(dt+gt)−x∗x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* + \lambda_t g_t = x_{t+1} + \lambda_{t+1} \textcolor{blue}{\gamma_{t+1} ( d_t + g_t )} - x^* \\ = x_t + d_t + g_t + \lambda_{t+1} \gamma_{t+1} ( d_t + g_t ) - x^*xt​+λt​dt​−x∗+λt​gt​=xt+1​+λt+1​γt+1​(dt​+gt​)−x∗=xt​+dt​+gt​+λt+1​γt+1​(dt​+gt​)−x∗
Then we get
γt(dt+gt)=(λt+1γk+1+1)(dt+gt)\gamma_t ( d_t + g_t ) = (\lambda_{t+1} \gamma_{k+1} + 1) ( d_t + g_t )γt​(dt​+gt​)=(λt+1​γk+1​+1)(dt​+gt​)
γt\gamma_tγt​ is a parameter we choose as a function of λt\lambda_tλt​ to force this hold. Then we define 2βut=∥xt+λtdt−x∗∥22\frac{2}{\beta} u_t = \|x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* \|_2^2β2​ut​=∥xt​+λt​dt​−x∗∥22​, and with the equality we get 2βut+1=∥xt+λtdt−x∗+λtgt∥22\frac{2}{\beta} u_{t+1} = \|x_t + \lambda_t d_t - x^* + \lambda_t g_t \|_2^2β2​ut+1​=∥xt​+λt​dt​−x∗+λt​gt​∥22​.
We have:
λt(λ−1)(a)+λt(b)≤ut−ut+1⏞use γt to make this telescopingλt2⋅δt+1−(λt2−λt)δt≤ut−ut+1\lambda_t (\lambda-1)(a) + \lambda_t (b) \le \overbrace{u_t - u_{t+1}}^{\text{use $\gamma_t$ to make this telescoping}} \\ \lambda_t^2 \cdot \delta_{t+1} - (\lambda_t^2 - \lambda_t)\delta_t \le u_t - u_{t+1}λt​(λ−1)(a)+λt​(b)≤ut​−ut+1​​use γt​ to make this telescoping​λt2​⋅δt+1​−(λt2​−λt​)δt​≤ut​−ut+1​
Use the same technology to use parameter λt\lambda_tλt​ to make LHS telescoping. Need:
λt2−λt=λt−12\lambda_t^2 - \lambda_t = \lambda_{t-1}^2λt2​−λt​=λt−12​
λt≈t\lambda_t \approx tλt​≈t will satisfly this, specifically: λt=−1±1+4λt−122\lambda_t = \frac{-1 \pm \sqrt{1+4 \lambda_{t-1}^2 } } {2}λt​=2−1±1+4λt−12​​​.
Now sum both sides:
λT2δT+1−λ02δ1≤u0−uT≤u0⇒δT+1≤constantλT2\lambda_T^2 \delta_{T+1} - \lambda_0^2 \delta_1 \le u_0 - u_T \le u_0 \\ \Rightarrow \delta_{T+1} \le \frac{constant}{\lambda_T^2}λT2​δT+1​−λ02​δ1​≤u0​−uT​≤u0​⇒δT+1​≤λT2​constant​
Recall: δt=f(xt)−f(x∗)\delta_t = f(x_t) - f(x^*)δt​=f(xt​)−f(x∗), so
f(xt)−f(x∗)≤∼1T2f(x_t) - f(x^*) \le \sim \frac{1}{T^2}f(xt​)−f(x∗)≤∼T21​

Summary

  1. Lower bounds for smooth convex opt are matched by GD + Momentum
  2. Choose coeff. caefully

Proximal Gradient.

start to talk about convex optimization there was another important component: constraint (here is the convex set)
min⁡: f(x)s.t.x∈X\min: \ f(x) \\ s.t. \quad \textcolor{red}{ x \in \mathscr{X} }min: f(x)s.t.x∈X

Projections and Proximal Operators

Projection Methods Idea:

Projected subgradient method

yt+1=xt−ηgt, gt∈∂f(xt)xt+1=ProjX(yt+1)y_{t+1} = x_t - \eta g_t, \ g_t \in \partial f(x_t) \\ x_{t+1} = \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}}(y_{t+1})yt+1​=xt​−ηgt​, gt​∈∂f(xt​)xt+1​=ProjX​(yt+1​)
Then
∥yt+1−x∗∥22=∥xt−ηgt−x∗∥22=∥xt−x∗∥22−2η<gt,xt−x∗>+η2∥gt∥22=∥xt−x∗∥22−2η(f(xt)−f(x∗))+η2G2⇒f(xt)−f(x∗)≤12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥yt+1−x∗∥22)+η2G2\| y_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 = \| x_t - \eta g_t -x^* \|_2^2 \\ = \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - 2 \eta \left < g_t, x_t - x^* \right > + \eta^2 \| g_t \|_2^2 \\ = \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - 2 \eta (f(x_t) - f(x^*) ) + \eta^2 G^2 \\ \Rightarrow f(x_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta} \bigg ( \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - \| y_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 \bigg ) + \frac{\eta}{2} G^2∥yt+1​−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−ηgt​−x∗∥22​=∥xt​−x∗∥22​−2η⟨gt​,xt​−x∗⟩+η2∥gt​∥22​=∥xt​−x∗∥22​−2η(f(xt​)−f(x∗))+η2G2⇒f(xt​)−f(x∗)≤2η1​(∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥yt+1​−x∗∥22​)+2η​G2
With x∗=ProjX(x∗),xt+1=ProjX(yt+1)x^* = \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}}( x^* ), x_{t+1} = \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}}(y_{t+1})x∗=ProjX​(x∗),xt+1​=ProjX​(yt+1​), we get
∥yt+1−x∗∥22≥∥xt+1−x∗∥22\| y_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 \ge \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2∥yt+1​−x∗∥22​≥∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​
Then
f(xt)−f(x∗)≤12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥xt+1−x∗∥22)+η2G2⇒f(1T∑xt)−f(x∗)≤12ηT⋅R2+η2G2→1T convergef(x_t) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta} \bigg ( \| x_t - x^* \|_2^2 - \| x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 \bigg ) + \frac{\eta}{2} G^2 \\ \Rightarrow f(\frac{1}{T} \sum x_t) - f(x^* ) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta} T \cdot R^2 + \frac{\eta}{2} G^2 \rightarrow \frac{1}{\sqrt{T}} \ \text{converge}f(xt​)−f(x∗)≤2η1​(∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​)+2η​G2⇒f(T1​∑xt​)−f(x∗)≤2η1​T⋅R2+2η​G2→T​1​ converge
Then everything goes through exactly as we had before.

Projection and the Prox operator

min⁡:f(x)s.t. x∈X⇔min⁡:f(x)+IX(x)Ix(x)={+∞,x∉X0,x∈X\min: f(x) \quad s.t. \ x \in \mathscr{X} \Leftrightarrow \min: f(x) + I_{\mathscr{X}}(x) \\ I_{\mathscr{x}}(x) = \left \{ \begin{aligned} + \infty,& x \notin \mathscr{X}\\ 0, & x \in \mathscr{X} \end{aligned} \right .min:f(x)s.t. x∈X⇔min:f(x)+IX​(x)Ix​(x)={+∞,0,​x∈/Xx∈X​
Note: Proj. subgradient vs subgrad on f(x)+IX(x)f(x) + I_{\mathscr{X}}(x)f(x)+IX​(x). Genenalize the inditor function to other convex function.
Def'n: For hhh convex function,
Proxh(y)=arg min⁡x:h(x)+12∥x−y∥22Proxηh(y)=arg min⁡x:h(x)+12η∥x−y∥22\text{Prox}_h(y) = \argmin_x: h(x) + \frac{1}{2} \| x - y \|_2^2 \\ \text{Prox}_{\eta h}(y) = \argmin_x: h(x) + \frac{1}{2 \eta} \| x - y \|_2^2Proxh​(y)=xargmin​:h(x)+21​∥x−y∥22​Proxηh​(y)=xargmin​:h(x)+2η1​∥x−y∥22​

Proximal Gradient Algorithm

moving away from the oracle model of computation
Proj GD: xt+1=ProjX(xt−η∇f(xt))x_{t+1} = \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}} ( x_t -\eta \nabla f(x_t) )xt+1​=ProjX​(xt​−η∇f(xt​))
Proximal GD: xt+1=Projηh(xt−η∇f(xt))x_{t+1} = \text{Proj}_{\eta h} ( x_t -\eta \nabla f(x_t) )xt+1​=Projηh​(xt​−η∇f(xt​))
Each iteration reuqires:

  1. evaluation of f,∇ff, \nabla ff,∇f.
  2. evaluation of prox operator.

Examples of Prox Operators

f(x)=∥x∥1=∑∣x1∣Proxηf(x)=arg min⁡u:∥u∥1+12η∥u−x∥22⇒(x−u)∈η∂∥u∥1f(x) = \|x \|_1 = \sum | x_1 | \\ \text{Prox}_{\eta f}(x) = \argmin_u: \| u \|_1 + \frac{1}{2 \eta} \| u-x \|_2^2 \\ \Rightarrow (x - u) \in \eta \partial \| u \|_1f(x)=∥x∥1​=∑∣x1​∣Proxηf​(x)=uargmin​:∥u∥1​+2η1​∥u−x∥22​⇒(x−u)∈η∂∥u∥1​
Recall:
z∈∂∥u∥1⇒zi={sign(ui),if ui≠0∈[−1,1],if ui=0z \in \partial \| u \|_1 \Rightarrow z_i = \left \{ \begin{aligned} \text{sign}(u_i), \quad & \text{if} \ u_i \neq 0 \\ \in [-1,1], \quad & \text{if} \ u_i = 0 \end{aligned} \right .z∈∂∥u∥1​⇒zi​={sign(ui​),∈[−1,1],​if ui​=0if ui​=0​
Then
(x−u)∈η∂∥u∥1⇒u:ui={xi−η,if xi≥η0,if ∣xi∣≤0xi+η,if xi≤−η(x - u) \in \eta \partial \| u \|_1 \Rightarrow u: \quad u_i = \left \{ \begin{aligned} x_i - \eta, \quad & \text{if} \ x_i \ge \eta \\ 0, \quad & \text{if} \ |x_i| \le 0 \\ x_i + \eta, \quad & \text{if} \ x_i \le -\eta \end{aligned} \right .(x−u)∈η∂∥u∥1​⇒u:ui​=⎩⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎧​xi​−η,0,xi​+η,​if xi​≥ηif ∣xi​∣≤0if xi​≤−η​
Ex:
Proxf(2−1/2−3)=(10−2),with η=1.\text{Prox}_f \begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -1/2\\ -3 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 \\ 0\\ -2 \end{pmatrix}, \quad \text{with} \ \eta = 1.Proxf​⎝⎛​2−1/2−3​⎠⎞​=⎝⎛​10−2​⎠⎞​,with η=1.
Sometimes call "soft-thresholding" or "shrinking".

  • f(x)=∑fi(xi)f(x) = \sum f_i (x_i)f(x)=∑fi​(xi​), then (proxηf(x))i=proxηfi(xi)( \text{prox}_{\eta f}(x) )_i = \text{prox}_{\eta f_i} (x_i)(proxηf​(x))i​=proxηfi​​(xi​)
  • Fact: Moro Decomposition: (Fenchel-Transform) f∗(y)=sup⁡x{<y,x>−f(x)}⇒x=proxf(x)+proxf∗(x)f^*(y) = \sup_x \{ \left < y,x \right > - f(x) \} \Rightarrow x = \text{prox}_f (x) + \text{prox}_{f^*}(x)f∗(y)=supx​{⟨y,x⟩−f(x)}⇒x=proxf​(x)+proxf∗​(x)

Composite functions: smooth + easy-prox

key motivation: Lasso

Proximal Gradient - Basic properties

min⁡:f(x)=g(x)⏞smooth+h(x)⏞easy-to-evaluate prox operatorxt+1=proxηh(xt−η∇g(xt))\min: f(x) = \overbrace{g(x)}^{\text{smooth}} + \overbrace{h(x)}^{\text{easy-to-evaluate prox operator}} \\ x_{t+1} = \text{prox}_{\eta h} ( x_t - \eta \nabla g(x_t))min:f(x)=g(x)​smooth​+h(x)​easy-to-evaluate prox operator​xt+1​=proxηh​(xt​−η∇g(xt​))
If h(x)=IX(x)h(x) = I_{\mathscr{X}} (x)h(x)=IX​(x) then prox-gradient becomes projected gradient.
Recall taht for projection: ∥y1−y2∥2≥∥ProjX(y1)−ProjX(y2)∥2\|y_1 - y_2\|_2 \ge \| \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}}(y_1) - \text{Proj}_{\mathscr{X}}(y_2) \|_2∥y1​−y2​∥2​≥∥ProjX​(y1​)−ProjX​(y2​)∥2​.
Similariliy:
<proxh(x)−proxh(y),x−y>≥∥proxh(x)−proxh(y)∥22⇒c.z.∥proxh(x)−proxh(y)∥2≤∥x−y∥2\left <\text{prox}_{h}(x) - \text{prox}_{h}(y), x- y \right > \ge \| \text{prox}_{h}(x) - \text{prox}_{h}(y) \|_2^2 \\ \overset{c.z.}{\Rightarrow} \| \text{prox}_{h}(x) - \text{prox}_{h}(y) \|_2 \le \| x-y \|_2⟨proxh​(x)−proxh​(y),x−y⟩≥∥proxh​(x)−proxh​(y)∥22​⇒c.z.∥proxh​(x)−proxh​(y)∥2​≤∥x−y∥2​
Let u=proxh(x),v=proxh(y)u = \text{prox}_{h}(x), v = \text{prox}_{h}(y)u=proxh​(x),v=proxh​(y)
u=proxh(x)=arg min⁡:h(u)+12∥x−u∥220∈∂h(u)+(u−x)⇔(x−u)∈∂h(u),(y−v)∈∂h(v)u = \text{prox}_h(x) = \argmin: h(u) + \frac{1}{2} \| x-u \|_2^2 \\ 0 \in \partial h(u) + ( u - x) \\ \Leftrightarrow (x-u) \in \partial h(u) , (y-v) \in \partial h(v)u=proxh​(x)=argmin:h(u)+21​∥x−u∥22​0∈∂h(u)+(u−x)⇔(x−u)∈∂h(u),(y−v)∈∂h(v)
h is convex, then ∂h\partial h∂h is monotone
<(x−u)−(y−v),u−v>≥0⇒<x−y,u−v>≥∥u−v∥22⇒<proxh(x)−proxh(y),x−y>≥∥proxh(x)−proxh(y)∥22\left < (x-u) - (y-v), u-v \right > \ge 0 \\ \Rightarrow \left < x-y, u-v \right > \ge \| u -v \|_2^2 \\ \Rightarrow \left <\text{prox}_{h}(x) - \text{prox}_{h}(y), x- y \right > \ge \| \text{prox}_{h}(x) - \text{prox}_{h}(y) \|_2^2⟨(x−u)−(y−v),u−v⟩≥0⇒⟨x−y,u−v⟩≥∥u−v∥22​⇒⟨proxh​(x)−proxh​(y),x−y⟩≥∥proxh​(x)−proxh​(y)∥22​

Proximal Gradient - Gradient Mapping

  1. For smooth functions, key inequality:
    for GD of smooth fn g
    g(xt+1)=g(xt−1β∇g(xt))≤g(xt)−12β∥∇g(xt)∥22g(x_{t+1}) = g( x_t - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla g(x_t)) \le g(x_t) - \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla g(x_t) \|_2^2g(xt+1​)=g(xt​−β1​∇g(xt​))≤g(xt​)−2β1​∥∇g(xt​)∥22​
    Now, xt+1=proxηh(xt−η∇g(xt))x_{t+1} = \text{prox}_{\eta h } (x_t - \eta \nabla g(x_t))xt+1​=proxηh​(xt​−η∇g(xt​)).
  2. The gradient mapping:
    Def'n: Gη(x)=1η(x−proxηh(x−η∇g(x)))G_{\eta} (x) = \frac{1}{\eta} ( x - \text{prox}_{\eta h}(x - \eta \nabla g(x)) )Gη​(x)=η1​(x−proxηh​(x−η∇g(x))).
    This gives: xt+1=xt−ηGη(xt)x_{t+1} = x_t - \eta G_{\eta}(x_t)xt+1​=xt​−ηGη​(xt​).
    Note Gη(xt)G_{\eta}(x_t)Gη​(xt​) in general is not ∈∂f(xt)\in \partial f(x_t)∈∂f(xt​).

Optimal solutions are the only fixed points of the prox grad update

equivalently: Gη(x)=0G_{\eta}(x) = 0Gη​(x)=0 iff x minimizes f(x)=g(x)+h(x)f(x) = g(x) + h(x)f(x)=g(x)+h(x)
To see this:
Gη(x^)=0⇔1η(x^−proxηh(x^−η∇g(x^)))=0⇒x^=proxηh(x^−η∇g(x^))⇒(x^−η∇g(x^))−x^∈η∂h(x^)⇒0∈∇g(x^)+∂h(x^)G_{\eta}(\hat{x}) = 0 \Leftrightarrow \frac{1}{\eta} ( \hat{x} - \text{prox}_{\eta h}(\hat{x} - \eta \nabla g(\hat{x})) ) = 0 \\ \Rightarrow \hat{x} = \text{prox}_{\eta h}(\hat{x} - \eta \nabla g(\hat{x})) \\ \Rightarrow (\hat{x} - \eta \nabla g(\hat{x})) - \hat{x} \in \eta \partial h(\hat{x}) \\ \Rightarrow 0 \in \nabla g(\hat{x}) + \partial h ( \hat{x})Gη​(x^)=0⇔η1​(x^−proxηh​(x^−η∇g(x^)))=0⇒x^=proxηh​(x^−η∇g(x^))⇒(x^−η∇g(x^))−x^∈η∂h(x^)⇒0∈∇g(x^)+∂h(x^)

Key lemma

Need analog: g(xt−1β∇g(xt))≤g(xt)−12β∥∇g(xt)∥22g( x_t - \frac{1}{\beta} \nabla g(x_t)) \le g(x_t) - \frac{1}{2 \beta} \| \nabla g(x_t) \|_2^2g(xt​−β1​∇g(xt​))≤g(xt​)−2β1​∥∇g(xt​)∥22​.
f = g + h, g is β\betaβ-smooth, α\alphaα-s.c (α\alphaα maybe 0). η≤1/β\eta \le 1/\betaη≤1/β.
Lemma:

Consequence:
Use Lemma with z=xt,x=xtz = x_t, x= x_tz=xt​,x=xt​, then

Prox Gradient - Rates of Convergence

min⁡:f(x)=g(x)⏞smooth, maybe s.c.+h(x)⏞convex,easy-to-evaluate prox operatorxt+1=proxηh(xt−η∇g(xt)),η= 1/βGη(x)=1η(x−proxηh(x−η∇g(x)))xt+1=xt−ηGη(xt)\min: f(x) = \overbrace{g(x)}^{\text{smooth, maybe s.c.}} + \overbrace{h(x)}^{\text{convex,easy-to-evaluate prox operator}} \\ x_{t+1} = \text{prox}_{\eta h} ( x_t - \eta \nabla g(x_t)) , \eta = \ 1/\beta \\ G_{\eta} (x) = \frac{1}{\eta} ( x - \text{prox}_{\eta h}(x - \eta \nabla g(x)) ) \\ x_{t+1} = x_t - \eta G_{\eta}(x_t)min:f(x)=g(x)​smooth, maybe s.c.​+h(x)​convex,easy-to-evaluate prox operator​xt+1​=proxηh​(xt​−η∇g(xt​)),η= 1/βGη​(x)=η1​(x−proxηh​(x−η∇g(x)))xt+1​=xt​−ηGη​(xt​)
key lemma(with η≤1/β\eta \le 1/\betaη≤1/β):
f(x−ηG(x))≤f(z)+<Gη(x),x−z>−η2∥Gη(x)∥22−α2∥x−z∥22f(xt+1)−f(xt)≤−η2∥Gη(xt)∥22f(x - \eta G(x)) \le f(z) + \left < G_{\eta}(x), x-z \right > - \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x) \|_2^2 - \frac{\alpha}{2} \| x- z \|_2^2 \\ f(x_{t+1}) - f(x_t) \le - \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x_t) \|_2^2f(x−ηG(x))≤f(z)+⟨Gη​(x),x−z⟩−2η​∥Gη​(x)∥22​−2α​∥x−z∥22​f(xt+1​)−f(xt​)≤−2η​∥Gη​(xt​)∥22​
proof of key lemma:
f(x−ηG(x))=g(x−ηG(x))(a)+h(x−ηG(x))(b)(a)≤g(x)−η<∇g(x),Gη(x)>+η2∥Gη(x)∥22(smoothness of g)≤g(z)−<∇g(z),z−x>−α2∥z−x∥22−η<∇g(x),Gη(x)>+η2∥Gη(x)∥22(strongly convexity of g)(b)To upper bound, we need element of ∂h(x−ηG(x))Recall: u=proxηh(x)⇔x−u∈η∂h(x)⇒x−ηGη(x)=x−η⋅1η(x−proxηh(x−η∇g(x)))=proxηh(x−η∇g(x))⇒Gη(x)−∇g(x)∈∂h(x−η∇g(x))⇒(b)=h(x−η∇g(x))≤h(z)−<Gη(x)−∇g(x),z−(x−η∇g(x))>⇒(a)+(b)≤f(z)+<Gη(x),x−z>−η2∥Gη(x)∥22−α2∥x−z∥22f(x - \eta G(x)) = \underset{(a)}{g(x - \eta G(x))} + \underset{(b)}{h(x - \eta G(x))} \\ (a) \le g(x) - \eta \left < \nabla g(x), G_{\eta}(x) \right > + \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x) \|_2^2 \quad (\text{smoothness of }g) \\ \le g(z) - \left < \nabla g(z), z-x \right > - \frac{\alpha}{2}\|z-x\|_2^2 - \eta \left < \nabla g(x), G_{\eta}(x) \right > + \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x) \|_2^2 \quad (\text{strongly convexity of }g) \\ (b) \quad \text{To upper bound, we need element of } \partial h(x - \eta G(x)) \\ \text{Recall: } u = \text{prox}_{\eta h}(x) \Leftrightarrow x-u \in \eta \partial h(x) \\ \Rightarrow x - \eta G_{\eta}(x) = x - \eta \cdot \frac{1}{\eta} ( x - \text{prox}_{\eta h}(x - \eta \nabla g(x)) ) = \text{prox}_{\eta h}(x - \eta \nabla g(x)) \\ \Rightarrow G_{\eta}(x) - \nabla g(x) \in \partial h ( x - \eta \nabla g(x) ) \\ \Rightarrow (b) = h ( x - \eta \nabla g(x) ) \le h(z) - \left < G_{\eta}(x) - \nabla g(x), z - (x - \eta \nabla g(x)) \right > \\ \Rightarrow (a) + (b) \le f(z) + \left < G_{\eta}(x), x-z \right > - \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x) \|_2^2 - \frac{\alpha}{2} \| x- z \|_2^2f(x−ηG(x))=(a)g(x−ηG(x))​+(b)h(x−ηG(x))​(a)≤g(x)−η⟨∇g(x),Gη​(x)⟩+2η​∥Gη​(x)∥22​(smoothness of g)≤g(z)−⟨∇g(z),z−x⟩−2α​∥z−x∥22​−η⟨∇g(x),Gη​(x)⟩+2η​∥Gη​(x)∥22​(strongly convexity of g)(b)To upper bound, we need element of ∂h(x−ηG(x))Recall: u=proxηh​(x)⇔x−u∈η∂h(x)⇒x−ηGη​(x)=x−η⋅η1​(x−proxηh​(x−η∇g(x)))=proxηh​(x−η∇g(x))⇒Gη​(x)−∇g(x)∈∂h(x−η∇g(x))⇒(b)=h(x−η∇g(x))≤h(z)−⟨Gη​(x)−∇g(x),z−(x−η∇g(x))⟩⇒(a)+(b)≤f(z)+⟨Gη​(x),x−z⟩−2η​∥Gη​(x)∥22​−2α​∥x−z∥22​
Smooth but not strongly convex: α=0\alpha = 0α=0
lemma with z=x∗,x=xt:z = x^*, x = x_t:z=x∗,x=xt​:
f(xt+1)=f(xt−ηG(xt))≤f(x∗)+<Gη(xt),xt−x∗>−η2∥Gη(xt)∥22Compare smoothness: f(xt+1)−f(x∗)≤<∇f(xt),xt−x∗>−η2∥∇f(xt)∥22f(xt+1)−f(x∗)≤<Gη(xt),xt−x∗>−η2∥Gη(xt)∥22=12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥xt−x∗−ηGη(xt)∥22)quadratic technology=12η(∥xt−x∗∥22−∥xt+1−x∗∥22)⇒f(xT)−f(x∗)≤1T(∑f(xt)−f(x∗))≤12ηT(∥x1−x∗∥22−∥xT−x∗∥22)≤12ηT⋅∥x1−x∗∥22∼O(1/T)f(x_{t+1}) = f(x_t - \eta G(x_t)) \le f(x^*) + \left < G_{\eta}(x_t), x_t - x^* \right > - \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x_t) \|_2^2 \\ \text{Compare smoothness: } f(x_{t+1}) - f(x^*) \le \left < \nabla f(x_t), x_t - x^* \right > - \frac{\eta}{2} \| \nabla f(x_t) \|_2^2 \\ f(x_{t+1}) - f(x^*) \le \left < G_{\eta}(x_t), x_t - x^* \right > - \frac{\eta}{2} \| G_{\eta}(x_t) \|_2^2 \\ = \textcolor{blue}{\frac{1}{2 \eta}\big ( \|x_t -x^* \|_2^2 - \|x_t - x^* - \eta G_{\eta}(x_t)\|_2^2 \big )} \quad \text{quadratic technology} \\ = \frac{1}{2 \eta}\big ( \|x_t -x^* \|_2^2 - \|x_{t+1} - x^* \|_2^2 \big ) \\ \Rightarrow f(x_T) - f(x^*) \le \frac{1}{T} (\sum f(x_t) - f(x^*)) \le \frac{1}{2 \eta T} \big ( \|x_1 -x^* \|_2^2 - \|x_{T} - x^* \|_2^2 \big ) \\ \le \frac{1}{2 \eta T} \cdot \|x_1 -x^* \|_2^2 \quad \sim O(1/T)f(xt+1​)=f(xt​−ηG(xt​))≤f(x∗)+⟨Gη​(xt​),xt​−x∗⟩−2η​∥Gη​(xt​)∥22​Compare smoothness: f(xt+1​)−f(x∗)≤⟨∇f(xt​),xt​−x∗⟩−2η​∥∇f(xt​)∥22​f(xt+1​)−f(x∗)≤⟨Gη​(xt​),xt​−x∗⟩−2η​∥Gη​(xt​)∥22​=2η1​(∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥xt​−x∗−ηGη​(xt​)∥22​)quadratic technology=2η1​(∥xt​−x∗∥22​−∥xt+1​−x∗∥22​)⇒f(xT​)−f(x∗)≤T1​(∑f(xt​)−f(x∗))≤2ηT1​(∥x1​−x∗∥22​−∥xT​−x∗∥22​)≤2ηT1​⋅∥x1​−x∗∥22​∼O(1/T)

Mirror Descent

Revisiting Gradient Guarantees - dimension independent

  • Changing the proximilty term to a different norm gives a different algorithm.
  • Different Lipschitz constant using differnt norm.

Connection: Our guarantees for convergence rate have LLL in these. So far we have focused only on dependence on T.

Hidden dimension dependence

conv. guarantee for subgradient method:
∥x1−x∗∥⋅LT\frac{ \| x_1 - x^* \| \cdot L }{\sqrt{ T }}T​∥x1​−x∗∥⋅L​
my hide dimension-dependence.
For problem
min⁡:f(x)s.t.x∈X\min: f(x) \\ s.t. \quad x \in \mathscr{X}min:f(x)s.t.x∈X
suppose it is l-Lipschitz but with respect to a different norm. Ex: ∥∇f(x)∥∞≤1\| \nabla f(x) \|_{\infty} \le 1∥∇f(x)∥∞​≤1 (we have exactily this for ∥⋅∥1\| \cdot \|_1∥⋅∥1​).

Our current bound only work with LLL as computed using ∥⋅∥2\| \cdot \|_2∥⋅∥2​ norm!
∥f(x)∥∞≤1⇒∥∇f(x)∥2≤n\| f(x) \|_{\infty} \le 1 \Rightarrow \| \nabla f(x) \|_2 \le \sqrt{n}∥f(x)∥∞​≤1⇒∥∇f(x)∥2​≤n​

Idea:
xt+1=arg min⁡:ηgtTx+12∥x−xt∥22⏞change this!x_{t+1} = \argmin: \eta g_t^T x + \overbrace{ \frac{1}{2} \| x - x_t \|_2^2 }^{\textcolor{red}{change \ this!}}xt+1​=argmin:ηgtT​x+21​∥x−xt​∥22​​change this!​

Bregman Divergence

For ϕ\phiϕ convex,
Dϕ(x,y)=△ϕ(x)−[ϕ(y)+∇ϕ(y)T(x−y)]D_{\phi}(x, y) \overset{\triangle }{=} \phi(x) - \bigg [ \phi(y) + \nabla \phi(y)^T (x-y) \bigg ]Dϕ​(x,y)=△ϕ(x)−[ϕ(y)+∇ϕ(y)T(x−y)]
Simple intution

Ex: ϕ(x)=12∥x∥22\phi(x) = \frac{1}{2} \| x \|_2^2ϕ(x)=21​∥x∥22​,
Dϕ(x,y)=12∥x∥22−[12∥y∥22+yT(x−y)]=12[∥x∥22−2yTx−∥y∥22+2∥y∥22]=12∥x−y∥22D_{\phi}(x, y) = \frac{1}{2} \| x \|_2^2 - \bigg [ \frac{1}{2} \| y \|_2^2 + y^T(x-y) \bigg ] \\ = \frac{1}{2} \bigg [ \| x \|_2^2 - 2 y^T x - \| y \|_2^2 + 2 \| y \|_2^2 \bigg ] \\ = \frac{1}{2} \| x - y \|_2^2Dϕ​(x,y)=21​∥x∥22​−[21​∥y∥22​+yT(x−y)]=21​[∥x∥22​−2yTx−∥y∥22​+2∥y∥22​]=21​∥x−y∥22​
